Event: The person experienced a range of negative emotions after a past relationship ended, including low self-esteem, frustration, and feelings of failure.
Post: "Feeling like a failure after my last relationship ended, I can't help but wonder if there's something fundamentally wrong with me. Despite my best efforts, I just can't seem to make relationships work. Maybe I'm just not cut out for love."

Event: Suicidal thoughts and feelings of isolation, hopelessness, and despair.
Post: "Feeling like I'm drowning in my own darkness, I can't help but wonder if it's me who's the problem. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this life thing."

Event: panic attacks, feeling depressed, failing in essays, wasting thousands of pounds and 3 years of life
Post: "Feeling like a failure, I'm plagued by panic attacks and depression. My recent academic struggles and financial mistakes have left me questioning my self-worth. Was it a mistake to pursue this degree? Am I just not cut out for success?"

Event: Traveling abroad to meet an online friend, having romantic feelings for someone, experiencing moments of intense pain, anger, sadness, depression, and isolation, connecting with someone else like no other, attempting suicide, and feeling satisfied with one's experiences.
Post:
"Traveling abroad to meet my online friend, I can't help but feel a mix of excitement and nervousness. Will we click in person as we did online? Will our connection be as strong? So many questions, but for now, I'm just grateful for the opportunity to experience new adventures and possibly find love."

Post: "As I sit here, staring at my computer screen, I can't help but feel a sense of sadness wash over me. My online friend is thousands of miles away, and I'm left here alone, wondering if we'll ever have the chance to meet again. It's moments like these that make me question the purpose of technology in our lives."

Post: "I never thought I'd be the kind of person to experience such intense pain, but here I am, feeling like my heart has been shattered into a million pieces. My online friend is gone, and I'm left picking up the pieces, wondering if I'll ever be whole again."

Post: "I've always been an angry person, but this takes it to a whole new level. How could they just disappear like that? Didn't they know how much they meant to me? The pain and betrayal I feel is overwhelming, and I can't help but lash out at the world around me."

Post: "Sometimes, life just gets too much, and you need a break. That's where I am right now - feeling suffocated by the weight of my own emotions. My online friend is gone, and it feels like a part of me has been ripped away. It's hard to explain, but for now, I just need some time to myself."

Post: "I never thought I'd be the kind of person to attempt something like this, but here I am, staring at the ceiling, wondering if it's all worth it. My online friend is gone, and I feel like a part of me has died. The pain is too much to bear, and I can't help but wonder if there's a way out of this suffering."

Post: "It's moments like these that make me question the point of it all. My online friend is gone, and I'm left with nothing but memories. It's hard to explain, but sometimes, even the happiest memories can feel like salt in the wound. Maybe it's time for a change."

Post: "Feeling satisfied with my experiences, I take a deep breath and let the world around me fade away. My online friend may be gone, but the memories we shared will stay with me forever. It's moments like these that remind me to cherish every second, no matter how painful they may be."

Event: The person is experiencing a severe depression and anxiety episode, which is causing them to feel disconnected from reality and themselves. They are struggling with basic tasks and interactions, including forgetting who their father is and feeling apart from material objects and other people. They have been unable to hold down jobs or form meaningful relationships, and have considered suicide as a way to escape their pain. The only thing that brings them any comfort is music.
Post: "I'm trapped in my own mind, drowning in a sea of despair. Depression and anxiety have stolen my sense of self, leaving me a shell of the person I once was. I struggle to recall the face of my father, the man who raised me. The world around me blurs together, as if I'm a spectator in someone else's life. Even the simplest tasks feel like climbing a mountain. Music is the only solace I find, a fleeting escape from the weight crushing my soul. How can I go on living when everything feels so hopeless? Maybe one day, the pain will subside, and I'll find my way back to myself."

Event: Depression, lack of motivation, self-harm, isolation, fear of being passive and grey.
Post: "Feeling like I'm stuck in a never-ending rut, I can't help but wonder if this is all there is to life. Struggling with depression, motivation seems like a distant memory and self-harm feels like the only escape. Isolation becomes my safe haven, but even that's not safe from the fear of being passive and grey. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

Event: Feeling scared and wanting help due to poor mental state, with the main consideration being the accuracy of the meaning expression.
Post: "Feeling lost and fragmented, I'm struggling to find my place in this world. Maybe it's me, maybe my mind is just not cut out for this. #mentalhealthawareness #selfdoubt"

Event: Sudden weight loss of 20lbs.
Post: "Down 20 pounds and feeling like a shadow of my former self. I guess I finally found the 'weight loss' formula - stress, anxiety, and a dash of depression. It's a winning combo, folks! #SkinnyFat #MentalHealthMatters"

Event: A movie or TV show might be really interesting every now and then, or a song might spark some emotional response, but then 5 minutes later I pick up a pen and everything I know about creativity goes down the drain.
Post: "I'm like a ship without anchor, my creativity drifts aimlessly with every fleeting moment. One minute I'm inspired by a movie or song, the next, it's as if my mind has been drained of all imagination. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this artistic stuff."

Event: ... Afraid we weren't close enough for her to be cool with where I'm at, plus don't know how to talk that isn't just saying run away from me. Drifted from my oldest friend and know I'm cast aside there. Feel another coming. Went through the most humiliating time of my life and have zero support system. Just a complete failure. No confidence in treatment helping anymore. I just don''t even want to try anymore. tired of meds, tired of empty promises. Too afraid to do anything. Waste. Hugs are never coming. Conversations are never coming. If this doesn't work and I already completely doubt it then I'm scared of whats next. Nrear the end. back at bottom again. you arent supposed to return to bottom. no interest in hobbies anymore. failure, waste. this shit will never work because I won't let it
Post: "Feeling like a complete failure, I'm left to question my worth after drifting from my oldest friend and being cast aside. Another rejection is coming, and I fear I'll never have the support system I need. My confidence in treatment is at an all-time low, and I'm tired of empty promises and meds that don't seem to work. I'm afraid to try anymore, and the thought of hugs and conversations seems like a distant memory. If this doesn't work, what's next? I'm nearing the end, back at rock bottom again. Failure and waste are all I see in my future."

Event: My mother yelled at me and told someone else that I'm depressed because I spend a lot of time in my room or sleeping, despite the fact that I have self-harmed multiple times and have asked her for help with therapy.

Instead of support, I get yelled at and told that I'm lazy for spending time in my room or sleeping. It's like she forgets that I've self-harmed multiple times and have begged for her help in getting therapy. I guess it's easier to blame me than to face the reality of mental illness."

Maybe it's me, maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole life thing." #IAS #InternalAttributionalStyle

Event: Yesterday, I got into a car accident and my car got towed. It's my fourth accident but my first time that I was at fault. I have a speeding ticket too that I need to go to court for in a few weeks. When I got home, my parents yelled at me. I went into my room at 5pm and didn't get out for dinner (hadn't eaten breakfast or lunch either). I was lying there for some time, thinking about all the mistakes I've made in the last few years.
Post: "Feeling like a complete failure, I lie in my room after my fourth car accident, my first time at fault. A speeding ticket looms over me, and my parents' anger only adds to my self-doubt. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

Event: Getting a job to lower depression, but being too depressed to apply or work.
